text: basically safe harbor allows us
companies like Google Facebook and many
others to simply transfer data from
Europe to the United States for
processing which normally the EU is a
bit careful about but it's a blanket
permission because the United States is
supposed to have adequate protections of
privacy this Austrian student mark
shrems privacy campaigner he was
concerned in the light of the Edward
Snowden revelations that US intelligence
agencies could be looking at his data
mass surveillance could be underway the
US said that was not the case but the
European Court has now said he may well
have a case and they've declared this
whole safe harbor ruling invalid and
what's more they've told the Irish data
authority which is in charge of Facebook
in Europe that they're going to have a
look and decide frankly whether they
should stop all of the flow of data from
Facebook to the United States it means a
lot of work for lawyers a lot of work
for data protection regulators and a lot
of worry for companies who won't be
quite sure yet where they stand
